title: Overview
content: Invention as an ironman follows the same core training loop as P2P — augment items, use them, siphon or disassemble for XP — but you must gather all materials through gameplay rather than the Grand Exchange.

The key sources of disassembly materials as an ironman: Slayer drops (armour, weapons, and noted items from monsters), Smithing (make and disassemble your own metal items), Crafting (leather items, jewelry), and Dungeoneering rewards.
Divine charges require Divine energy from Divination — build your Divination level alongside Invention to ensure a steady supply of charges.

title: Material Gathering
content: Slayer is the best passive source of disassembly items as an ironman. Monsters drop a huge variety of equipment that can be disassembled — do not alch everything. Prioritise saving items whose disassembly gives components you need for perks.
Smelt and smith your own metal items for Metallic and other component types. Iron and Steel items are cheap to produce in bulk and disassemble well for base components.
Dungeoneering provides Crackers and other oddments that disassemble for unique components. The Invention store in Daemonheim can sell some useful items.

title: Training Progression
content: Complete the full Invention tutorial after meeting the requirements (80 Attack, 80 Defence, 80 Smithing). The tutorial walks you through creating your first Divine charges and Augmentor.
Early levels: disassemble the equipment gathered from Slayer tasks for XP and materials. Supplement with any Smithed items you produce from ores mined during Mining training.
From level 27 onwards, augment your most-used weapons and tools. These level up passively during your normal combat and skilling, making Invention very manageable as a side activity.

title: Key Priorities for Ironmen
content: Honed perks on tools (Pickaxe, Hatchet, Fishing rod) are exceptionally valuable for ironmen — they increase resource yield and significantly reduce the grind of gathering skills. Reach level 60+ Invention to research Honed 3 as soon as possible.
Efficient perk on armour and weapons reduces Divine charge consumption, extending the time between recharges. This reduces the Divination/energy burden.
Crackling and Relentless perks on combat gear improve DPS, making boss kills faster — critical for an ironman who needs drops for other skills. Prioritise strong combat perks early.
